Description:
Detects execution of netcat with the "-e" flag followed by common shells. This could be a sign of a potential reverse shell setup.

Author: @d4ns4n_, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potential Netcat Reverse Shell Execution
Query: sourcetype like 'linux-%' eql select * from _source_ where ((process_path like '%/nc' or process_path like '%/ncat') and (command like '% -c %' or command like '% -e %') and (command like '% ash%' or command like '% bash%' or command like '% bsh%' or command like '% csh%' or command like '% ksh%' or command like '% pdksh%' or command like '% sh%' or command like '% tcsh%' or command like '%/bin/ash%' or command like '%/bin/bash%' or command like '%/bin/bsh%' or command like '%/bin/csh%' or command like '%/bin/ksh%' or command like '%/bin/pdksh%' or command like '%/bin/sh%' or command like '%/bin/tcsh%' or command like '%/bin/zsh%' or command like '%$ifsash%' or command like '%$ifsbash%' or command like '%$ifsbsh%' or command like '%$ifscsh%' or command like '%$ifsksh%' or command like '%$ifspdksh%' or command like '%$ifssh%' or command like '%$ifstcsh%' or command like '%$ifszsh%'))
